main event: On 3rd April 1949, a reliable civilian reported sighting an unconventional aircraft, commonly known as a 'Flying Disc', at Dillon, Montana.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 3,000 to 5,000 feet and appeared to be rocking or rotating in a semi-circular motion.
It was described as having a metallic color, with the upper side appearing bright and the lower side being bluish-gray or greenish-gray.
The object traveled at extremely high speeds, estimated to be faster than 1,000 miles per hour, and it seemed to blur according to the observers.
The object did not show any evidence of exhaust, smoke, or sound, and it did not have any visible propelling fins, stabilizers, or duct openings.
Multiple reliable witnesses, including commercial pilots and aviation engineers, confirmed the sighting and provided consistent descriptions of the object.
sighted object: unconventional aircraft, commonly known as a 'Flying Disc'
witnesses: reliable civilian observers, commercial pilot, aviation engineer
photographs: no photographs included in the report
